tt.sent: 3/16/6 Oncology Clinic F/U 74 y old man with CAD, CHF with EF 25% who was referred to Oncology for further evaluation and management of a mass in the left hepatic lobe measuring 6 x6.6cm.
The mass was first noted on CT scan in 8/5, and a CT guided biopsy was performed 10/3/5 showing an invasive malignant neoplasm, of uncertain histogenesis.
He was admitted for CHF in 12/5 and a repeat biopsy was performed, showing findings suspicious for metastatic melanoma versus GIST.
He was readmitted in 1/6 for CHF, and he gave permission for his biopsy to be reviewed at University of Pennsylvania by Dr. Ddddd Dddddd.
Has started Gleevec for suspected GIST based on outside pathology review.
Brain MRI on 2/28 showed old cerebellar infarcts which I think could be contributing to his difficulty with balance and gait.
At last visit, he complained of diarrhea, which may be realated to Gleevec, and Imodium was recommended.
Today, he says he has worse dizziness than ever, which usually comes on when getting up to walk, accompanied by nausea.
He feels like the world is spending.
He has not had any fever.
He also has diarrhea, alternating with constipation.
At times he has the desire to have a bowel movement, but nothing comes out.
When he does have diarreha, it hurts his stomach.
He also complains of zero appetite.
He chews the food and spits it out.

section.tt: PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: . CHF / DCM ? etiology --EF: 25% on Cath in 10/2002 . CAD . Liver mass -> ? metastatic melanoma . TIA in 4/2 . HTN . LV thrombus seen on TTE treated with anticoagulant on clinical trial PAST SURGICAL HISTORY: . 11/2003 - Cholycestectomy . b/l cataract repair . ? Ex-lap in 2000 . 12/2002- TURP . 1993- perirectal abscess drainage . L inguinal hernia repair -1950 ALLERGIES: NKDA MEDICATIONS: Meclizine 25 mg TID Gleevec 400 mg QD Fentanyl patch 25 mcg Lisinopril 40mg po daily Percocet Senna 2 tabs po bedtime prn constipation Colace 100mg po tid prn Lipitor 10mg daily Proscar 5mg po bedtime Prilosec OTC 20mg poqd Lasix 40mg po bid Imdur 30mg po daily Coreg 3.125mg po bid PMD: Dr. Vvvvv (AIM clinic) Cardiologist: -Dr. Gggggg 212-781-9223 SOCIAL HISTORY: . Lives alone. Retired factory worker . No ETOH, past cig smoker (stopped more than 25 yr ago) . Remote smoking Hx, stopped > 25 yr ago . No ETOH, no illicit drug use . Has HHA 3 hr x 5 days per week,VNS FAMILY HISTORY: NC REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: see HPI T 96.2 BP 118/60 HR 67 Wt 142 (-2) Ht 65 GEN: pleasant elderly man, NAD HEENT: MMM, OP clear, anicteric, no nystagmus NECK: No LAN CV: S1, S2, II/VI soft SEM murmur heard at apex LUNGS: Dec BS at the bases, no crackles, no wheezing. ABD: + cholecystectomy scar in RUQ, Vertical suprapubic scar. Both well healed. Mildly distended. + BS, soft, mildy tender to deep palpation in RUQ and LLQ. No Murphy's. no ascites, b/l inguinal hernias EXT: no edema b/l, 2+ DP pulses b/l LABORATORY DATA: 3/16/6 WBC 8.4 Hb 11.3 HCT 34.2 PLT 208 2/27/6 WBC 9.1, Hb 11.8, HCT 35.9, PLT 262 2/6/6 WBC 7.1, Hb 11.1, HCT 33.7, PLT 322 12/20/5 WBC 8.9, Hb 12.4, PLT 279 12/5/5 WBC 7.8, Hb 11.1, PLT 304 10/27/5 Retic 4.7, Fe 35, Ferr 65, TIBC 350 9/27/5 AFP: 2.1(wnl); 9/27/5 CEA: 0.9 (wnl), 10/12/5 CA19-9 = 32 9/27/5 HCV Ab negative, HBsAg neg, HBsAb neg, HBcAb pos EGD (3/2005): wnl Colonoscopy 11/9/5 - WNL IMPRESSION: 74 y old man with significant cardiac disease and liver mass with pelvic and mesenteric masses of unclear etiology being treated for probable GIST. 1. Liver mass, probable GIST - continue Gleevec. Would usually scan after 2-3 months of treatment, but given lots of GI symptoms, will check CT scan now to r/o partial obstruction or other. 2. Abdominal pain - continue fentanyl/percocet.. Refill of fentanyl given (#10) 3. Dizziness - brai n MRI with old cerebelar infarcts, possibly responsible for patient's symtpoms. Nothing acute. Already on Meclizine. Has appointment with Dr. Zzzzzzzzz next month. Also, check B12/folate. Gleevec can cause dizziness in 10-12% of patients according to PDR. 5. Poor appetite - continue Megace; call prescription for Ensure. RTC 2 weeks D/W Dr. Yyyyyy Yyyy Yyyyyyyy, MD NNNNN
